comment.author: 67127882@N07
comment._content: Some of the Hehe men, dressed in traditional costume, assembled for the ceremony of the return by the Governor of Tanganyika, Sir Edward Twining, KCMG, of the skull of the former Hehe Chief and war-leader, Mkwawa, at Kalenga, Iringa District, 9 June 1954.  The skull had been taken to Germany by the German colonial authorities after Mkwawa's death in 1898.
